flicker 0.0.2.4
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Evaluate When

Source: R/when.R
when.Rd

Evaluate expressions against a Spark DataFrame (or data.frame) if a predicate evaluates to TRUE. Note that these functions are subtly different from the scoped variants of dplyr functions in that they can evaluate any predicate.

arrange_when(.data, .eval, ...)

distinct_when(.data, .eval, ...)

filter_when(.data, .eval, ...)

group_by_when(.data, .eval, ...)

mutate_when(.data, .eval, ...)

select_when(.data, .eval, ...)

summarise_when(.data, .eval, ...)

transmute_when(.data, .eval, ...)

Arguments

.data

A Spark DataFrame or a data.frame.
.eval

A formula(). The LHS is the predicate to evaluate. When it evaluates to TRUE, the RHS will be performed in the context of the function. The RHS can be in one of several forms:

  • An expression, e.g. x * y

  • A named expression, e.g. c(z = x * y)

  • A vector or list of the above.

Note: named expressions must be wrapped in c() or list().
...

Additional parameters to pass to the dplyr function.

Value

A Spark DataFrame or a data.frame depending on the input, .data.

Examples

# Unname expressions will return columns with the expression as the name
mtcars %>% mutate_when("cyl" %in% colnames(mtcars) ~ mpg * 2)

#>     mpg cyl  disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb mpg * 2
#> 1  21.0   6 160.0 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4    42.0
#> 2  21.0   6 160.0 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4    42.0

# We can evaluate multiple expressions
mtcars %>%
  mutate_when("cyl" %in% colnames(mtcars) ~ c(mpg2 = mpg * 2, mpg4 = mpg * 2))

#>     mpg cyl  disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb mpg2 mpg4

# We can still use functionality such as tidy-select
mtcars %>%
  select_when("cyl" %in% colnames(mtcars) ~ c(Cylinders = cyl, everything()))
